importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was last seen at her workplace on October 4, 2025, marking the beginning of the investigation into her disappearance.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The investigation into Kada Scott’s disappearance began after she went missing on October 4, 2025, and key developments, including the discovery of remains and arrests, occurred within the following two weeks.

keyTakeAways: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing on October 4, 2025, after leaving her workplace and disconnecting from all digital communication.
Human remains believed to belong to Kada Scott were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in a wooded area, two weeks after her disappearance.
A tip from an anonymous source led police to the grave, and tracking phone communications helped identify Keon King as the suspect in Scott’s kidnapping.
Keon King, 21, is charged with the kidnapping of Kada Scott and a prior kidnapping case involving a woman from earlier in the year, suggesting a pattern of behavior.
King previously faced dropped charges in a domestic kidnapping case in May 2025 due to a witness’s failure to appear, and those charges have been refiled.
Video evidence from the earlier case is expected to be played during preliminary hearings, which are scheduled for the coming months.
The Philadelphia Police Department, with FBI assistance, is investigating the case and has received public tips, including one leading to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry linked to King.
Authorities believe Scott may have been in the car at some point, and the vehicle is under investigation for possible connections to her disappearance.
The case has prompted public calls for information, as the family and investigators believe small details could be critical to solving the mystery.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Two weeks after a 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing on October 4, 2025, human remains believed to belong to her were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school. Police say a tip led to the grave, and digital evidence, including phone tracking, identified Keon King, 21, as the suspect in her kidnapping. King is charged with Scott’s disappearance and a prior domestic kidnapping case, with a history of similar behavior. Authorities believe Scott may have been in a gold 1999 Toyota Camry linked to King, which was found through a public tip. The case has sparked a broader investigation into a possible pattern of criminal behavior, with the Philadelphia Police Department and FBI working together to identify leads. The family is urging the public to come forward with information, as they believe even small details could be crucial in bringing Kada home.
title: Police Investigate Disappearance of Philadelphia Woman; Remains Found in Shallow Grave After Anonymous Tip
